Alaris.Irc.Sender Class Reference

This class is used to send all the IRC commands except for CTCP and DCC messages. Instances of this class are retrieved as properties of the Connection object. All methods in this class are thread safe. More...

Detailed Description

This class is used to send all the IRC commands except for CTCP and DCC messages. Instances of this class are retrieved as properties of the Connection object. All methods in this class are thread safe.

Due to the asynchronous nature of IRC, none of these commands have a return value. To get that value (or possibly an error) the client must handle the corresponding event. For example, to check if a user is online the client would send Sender.Ison then check the value of the Listener.OnIson event to receive the answer.

When a command can return an error, the possible error replies are listed. An error message will be sent via the Listener.OnError event with one of the listed error codes as a parameter. When checking for these errors use the constants from ReplyCode.

The maximum length of any command string sent to the server is 512 characters.

            //Create a Connection object which will automatically create its own Sender
            Connection connection = new Connection( args, false, false );   
            //Send commands using the Connection object and its Sender instance.
            //No need to keep a separate reference to the Sender object
            connection.Sender.PublicMessage("#thresher", "hello");

Member Function Documentation

void Alaris.Irc.Sender.Action ( string  channel,
string  description 
)

Send an action message to a channel.

This is actually a CTCP command but it is so widely used that it is included here. These are the ' Laughs' type messages.

Parameters:
channel The target channel.
description A description of the action. If this is too long it will be truncated.
                //Express an emotion...
                connection.Sender.Action("#thresher", "Kicks down the door" );
Exceptions:
ArgumentException If the channel name is not valid. Will also be thrown if the description is null or empty.
See also:
Listener.OnAction
void Alaris.Irc.Sender.Admin (  ) 

Request information about the administrator of the current IRC server.

This returns information such as the administrator's email address, geographical location and whatever else the IRC is configured to send as a response.

See also:
Listener.OnAdmin
void Alaris.Irc.Sender.Admin ( string  target  ) 

Request information about the administrator of the target IRC server.

This returns information such as the administrator's email address, geographical location and whatever else the IRC is configured to send as a response.

Possible Errors

  • ERR_NOSUCHSERVER
Parameters:
target Either a user nickname or a specific IRC server connected to the current network. If it is a nickname then return the information about the server to which 'nick' is connected. Can include wildcards.
                //Request info about the administrator of the specified server
                connection.Sender.Admin( "sunray.sharkbite.org" );
                //Request info about the administrator of the server Bob is connected to
                connection.Sender.Admin("Bob");
See also:
Listener.OnAdmin

void Alaris.Irc.Sender.Away ( string  message  ) 

Set the user status to away and set an automatic reply to any private message.

This functions as a kind of IRC answering machine. It is normally used to indicate that the user is away from IRC.

Parameters:
message The message that will be sent back to others when you are away. Overly long message will be truncated.
Exceptions:
ArgumentException If the message is null or empty.
See also:

ModeAction  action,
ChannelMode  mode,
string  param 
)

Change a channel's mode.

Possible Errors

  • ERR_NEEDMOREPARAMS
  • ERR_KEYSET
  • ERR_NOCHANMODES
  • ERR_CHANOPRIVSNEEDED
  • ERR_USERNOTINCHANNEL
  • ERR_UNKNOWNMODE
Parameters:
channel The target channel.
action Add or remove.
mode The target mode.
param An optional parameter for certain modes. If the mode does not require one this should be null.
                //Give 'nick' the ability to talk on a moderated channel, i.e. add Voice
                connection.Sender.ChangeChannelMode("#thresher", ModeAction.Add, ChannelMode.Voice,"nick" );
                //Make a channel private
                connection.Sender.ChangeChannelMode( "#thresher", ModeAction.Add, ChannelMode.Private, null );
Exceptions:
ArgumentException If the channel name is invalid.
See also:
Listener.OnChannelModeChange

void Alaris.Irc.Sender.ChangeUserMode ( ModeAction  action,
UserMode  mode 
)

Changes this client's mode. To change another nick's mode use ChangeChannelMode.

Away cannot be set here but should be set using Sender.Away or removed using Sender.UnAway.

Parameters:
action Add or remove a mode.
mode The mode to be changed.
                //Turn off invisibility
                connection.Sender.ChangeUserMode( ModeAction.Remove, UserMode.Invisible );
                //Turn on wallops (and get a lot of IRC garbage)
                connection.Sender.ChangeUserMode( ModeAction.Add, UserMode.Wallops );
Exceptions:
ArgumentException If the UserMode parameter is Away.
See also:
Listener.OnUserModeChange

void Alaris.Irc.Sender.Invite ( string  who,
string  channel 
)

Invite a user to a channel.

The parameter nickname is the nickname of the person to be invited to the target channel channel. There is no requirement that the channel the target user is being invited to must exist or be a valid channel. However, if the channel exists, only members of the channel are allowed to invite other users. When the channel has invite-only flag set, only channel operators may an invite.

Only the user inviting and the user being invited will receive notification of the invitation. Other channel members are not notified. (This is unlike the mode changes, and is occasionally the source of trouble for users.)

After the invite is sent the IRC server will signal that it was correctly received by calling Listener.OnInviteSent.

Possible Errors

  • ERR_NEEDMOREPARAMS
  • ERR_NOSUCHNICK
  • ERR_NOTONCHANNEL
  • ERR_USERONCHANNEL
  • ERR_CHANOPRIVSNEEDED
Parameters:
who The nick of the person to invite
channel The channel they are invited to join.
Exceptions:
ArgumentException If the nickname or channel is not valid.
See also:
Listener.OnInviteSent, Listener.OnInvite

void Alaris.Irc.Sender.Join ( string  channel  ) 

Join the specified channel.

Once a user has joined a channel, he receives information about all commands his server receives affecting the channel. This includes JOIN, MODE, KICK, PART, QUIT and of course PRIVMSG/NOTICE. This allows channel members to keep track of the other channel members, as well as channel modes.

If a JOIN is successful, the user receives a JOIN message as confirmation and is then sent the channel's topic ( Listener.OnTopicRequest and the list of users who are on the channel ( Listener.OnNames ), which MUST include the user joining.

Possible Errors

  • ERR_NEEDMOREPARAMS
  • ERR_BANNEDFROMCHAN
  • ERR_INVITEONLYCHAN
  • ERR_BADCHANNELKEY
  • ERR_CHANNELISFULL
  • ERR_BADCHANMASK
  • ERR_NOSUCHCHANNEL
  • ERR_TOOMANYCHANNELS
  • ERR_TOOMANYTARGETS
  • ERR_UNAVAILRESOURCE
Parameters:
channel The channel to join. Channel names must begin with '&', '#', '+' or '!'.
                //Most channels you will see begin with the '#'. The others are reserved
                //for special channels and may not even be available on a particular server.
                connection.Sender.Join("#thresher");
Exceptions:
ArgumentException If the channel name is not valid.
See also:
Listener.OnJoin

Here is the caller graph for this function:

void Alaris.Irc.Sender.Kick ( string  channel,
string  reason,
params string[]  nicks 
)

Kick a user off a channel.

Possible Replies

  • ERR_NEEDMOREPARAMS
  • ERR_NOSUCHCHANNEL
  • ERR_BADCHANMASK
  • ERR_CHANOPRIVSNEEDED
  • ERR_USERNOTINCHANNEL
  • ERR_NOTONCHANNEL
Parameters:
nicks One or more users to kick.
channel Which channel to kick the user from.
reason Why.
                //Kick a single user
                connection.Sender.Kick("#thresher","No Perl please","lwall" );
                //Kicks several users at once
                connection.Sender.Kick( "#thresher", "Bye", "John","Dick","Harry" );
Exceptions:
ArgumentException If the nickname or channel is not valid or the reason is null.
See also:
Listener.OnKick

void Alaris.Irc.Sender.Links ( params string[]  masks  ) 

Request all server names which are known by the target server and which match a given host mask.

Possible Errors

  • ERR_NOSUCHSERVER
Parameters:
masks Either a single string which acts as a host mask filter for the query. Or two strings with the first as host mask and the second a target server. Any other arguments will be ignored.
                //Request names from the current server
                connection.Sender.Links();
                //Request names of all servers ending in '.net' from the current server
                connection.Sender.Links("*.edu" );
                //Request names of all servers ending in '.edu' from '*.gnome.org' servers
                connection.Sender.Links("*.edu", "*.gnome.org");
Exceptions:
ArgumentException If the masks are too long.
See also:
Listener.OnLinks

                //Make the request for a single channel

                //Make the request for several channels at once
                connection.Sender.List( "#test","#alpha",#"bravo" );

void Alaris.Irc.Sender.Lusers ( string  hostMask,
string  targetServer 
)

Request statistics about the size of the IRC network.

Possible Errors

  • ERR_NOSUCHSERVER
Parameters:
hostMask Limits the kinds of servers included in the response by specifiying a hostname string. Can include wildcards.
targetServer Specifies the server that should process the request. Can be null to indicate that the current server should handle the request. Can include wildcards.
                //Request stats from the current server
                connection.Sender.Lusers();
                //Request stats about all servers ending in '.net' from the current server
                connection.Sender.Lusers("*.net", null );
                //Request stats about all servers ending in '.net' from 'west.gamesnet.net'
                connection.Sender.Lusers("*.net", "west.gamesnet.net");
Exceptions:
ArgumentException If the host mask and server names are too long.
See also:
Listener.OnLusers

Send a message to a user.

If the target user status is away, the Listener.OnAway event will be called along with the away message if any.

  • ERR_NOTEXTTOSEND
  • ERR_NOSUCHNICK
Parameters:
nick The target user.
message A message. If the message is too long it will be broken up into smaller piecese which will be sent sequentially.
Exceptions:
ArgumentException If the nickname is not valid or if the message is null or empty.
See also:
Listener.OnPrivate
void Alaris.Irc.Sender.PrivateNotice ( string  nick,
string  message 
)

Send a notice to a user.

The difference between a notice and a normal message is that automatic replies must never be sent in response to a notice. This rule applies to servers too - they must not send any error reply back to the client on receipt of a notice. The object of this rule is to avoid loops between clients automatically sending something in response to something it received. See Sender.PrivateMessage for possible errors.

Parameters:
nick The target nickname.
message Text message. If the text is too large to be sent in one piece it will be broken up into smaller strings which will then be sent individually.
Exceptions:
ArgumentException If the nick is not valid or the message is empty or null.
See also:
Listener.OnPrivateNotice

See also:
Listener.OnPublic

Send a notice to a channel.

The difference between a notice and a normal message is that automatic replies must never be sent in response to a notice. This rule applies to servers too - they must not send any error reply back to the client on receipt of a notice. The object of this rule is to avoid loops between clients automatically sending something in response to something it received. See Sender.PublicMessage for possible errors.

Parameters:

void Alaris.Irc.Sender.Raw ( string  message  ) 

Send an arbitrary text message to the IRC server.

Messages that are too long will be truncated. There is no corresponding events so it will be necessary to check for standard reply codes and possibly errors.

Parameters:
message A text message.
Exceptions:
ArgumentException If the message is null or empty.

Here is the caller graph for this function:

void Alaris.Irc.Sender.Register ( string  newNick  ) 

Register this connection with the IRC server.

This method should be called when the initial attempt to register with the IRC server fails because the nick is already taken. To be informed when this fails you must be subscribed to Listener.OnNickError. If Connection.HandleNickTaken is set to true (which is its default value) then Thresher will automatically create an alternate nick and use that. The new nick can be retrieved by calling Connection.ConnectionData.Nick

Parameters:
newNick The changed nick name.
See also:
NameGenerator
void Alaris.Irc.Sender.RequestChannelList ( string  channel,
ChannelMode  mode 
)

Request the list of users that a channel keeps for the given mode..

Each channel maintains a list of those banned, those excepted from a ban, those on automatic invite, and the channel creator. Use this method to retreieve one of those lists.

Parameters:
channel The taregt channel.
mode Must be one of: Ban, Exception, Invitation, or ChannelCreator. 
                //Request the channel's banned list
                connection.Sender.RequestChannelList("#thresher", ChannelMode.Ban );
Exceptions:
ArgumentException If the channel is invalid or the ChannelMode is not one of the 4 allowed types.
See also:
Listener.OnChannelList

void Alaris.Irc.Sender.RequestTopic ( string  channel  ) 

Request the topic for the given channel.

The reply will be sent via the Listener.OnTopicRequest event. If there is no topic then Listener.OnError will be called with a code of ReplyCode.RPL_NOTOPIC.

Possible Errors

  • ERR_NEEDMOREPARAMS
  • ERR_NOTONCHANNEL
  • ERR_CHANOPRIVSNEEDED
  • ERR_NOCHANMODES
Parameters:
channel The target channel.
Exceptions:
ArgumentException If the channel name is not valid.
See also:
Listener.OnTopicRequest

Listener.OnUserModeRequest, UserMode
void Alaris.Irc.Sender.Stats ( StatsQuery  query  ) 

Request certain kinds of statistics about the current server.

Possible Errors

  • ERR_NOSUCHSERVER
Parameters:
query The type of query to send. See StatsQuery for choice.
                //Request server link stats
                connection.Sender.Stats( StatsQuery.Connections );
See also:
Listener.OnStats
void Alaris.Irc.Sender.Stats ( StatsQuery  query,
string  targetServer 
)

Request certain kinds of statistics about the current server.

Possible Errors

  • ERR_NOSUCHSERVER
Parameters:
query The type of query to send. See StatsQuery for choice.
targetServer Specifies the server that should process the request. Can include wildcards.
                //Request list of Operators from the server 'irc.gnome.org'
                connection.Sender.Stats( StatsQuery.Operators, "irc.gnome.org" );
Exceptions:
ArgumentException If the target server name is too long.
See also:
Listener.OnStats
void Alaris.Irc.Sender.Time ( string  targetServer  ) 

Request the local time from the given server.

Possible Errors

  • ERR_NOSUCHSERVER
Parameters:
targetServer The FQDN of the IRC server to query. Wildcards are allowed. Must be a server part of the same IRC network this connection is connected to.

void Alaris.Irc.Sender.Wallops ( string  message  ) 

Send a message to all users who have the 'w' user mode set.

This will likely be forbidden to all but IRC OPS.

Parameters:
message Any text message.
Exceptions:
ArgumentException If the message is empty or null.
void Alaris.Irc.Sender.Who ( string  mask,
bool  operatorsOnly 
)

Request a list of users who match a given query.

Possible Errors

  • ERR_TOOMANYLINES
Parameters:
mask The mask passed to Who is matched against a users' host, real name or nickname. It uses the wildcard system of matching where the '*' can stand for any number of characters and '?' stands for any single character. The query will only match against one component so it is not possible to match against both nick and host for example.
operatorsOnly True if the query should only try to match the mask to users designated operators.
                //Find all users from Russia, i.e. who have .ru in their hostnames
                connection.Sender.Who("*.ru", false );
                //Find all users from clan [DX], i.e. have '[DX]' in their nick
                connection.Sender.Who("[DX]*", false );
Exceptions:
ArgumentException If the mask is null,empty, or too long.
See also:
Listener.OnWho
void Alaris.Irc.Sender.Whois ( string  nick  ) 

Request detailed information about a given user.

Possible Errors

  • ERR_NOSUCHNICK
Parameters:
nick The nick of the query subject.
Exceptions:
ArgumentException If the nick is invalid.
See also:
Listener.OnWhois, WhoisInfo
void Alaris.Irc.Sender.Whowas ( string  nick,
int  count 
)

Request information about a user who is no longer on IRC but with a maximum number of responses.

Possible Errors

  • ERR_NONICKNAMEGIVEN
  • ERR_WASNOSUCHNICK
Parameters:
count The maximum number of replies the IRC server should send back.
nick Target nick
Exceptions:
ArgumentException If the nick is invalid or if count is less than or equal to zero.
See also:
Listener.OnWhowas
